sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH in emergencies - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) response including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply in emergencies - improving water supply services communities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: In 2019, the sector coordination, funding, monitoring and evaluation were strengthened through the political dialogue and regular consultation between the Government and its partners the basket fund and the development and implementation of monitoring mechanisms. Sector guidance documents were finalized, and municipal WASH planning was strengthened. The Government and its partners showed growing interest for climate sensitive programming as well as for the humanitarian/development nexus. UNICEF supported 139,870 people to gain access to safe drinking water and 36,327 people to sanitation facilities, including through CLTS in emergencies and the capacity building of actors from the Government, municipalities and partners. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/01/2020

4.5 Local governments (incl. municipalities) with functioning coordination mechanisms to strengthen the delivery of child focused services
Number of people in humanitarian situations with access to basic drinking water services
